schema.description: The region ID.
The client ID. The system generates a unique ID for each client.
The response parameters.
The region ID.
The client ID. The system generates a unique ID for each client.
The directory IDs.

items.description: The directory ID, which is the same as the office network ID.

schema.description: The response parameters.

SsoServiceUrl.description: The URL of the SSO service.

DesktopAccessType.description:
The connection method.

Valid values:

*   VPC: End users connect to cloud computers over an enterprise virtual private cloud (VPC).
*   INTERNET: End users connect to cloud computers over the Internet.
*   ANY: End users connect to cloud computers over the Internet or an enterprise VPC.

schema.title: uuid

schema.description:
The region ID.

Valid value:

*   cn-shanghai: China (Shanghai)

The office network IDs.

>  This parameter is about to be disabled. Use `OfficeSiteId`.

The office network IDs.

>  `DirectoryId` the parameter is about to be retired, use this field.
The unique ID generated by the client.
The session ID. You can call the GetLoginToken operation to query the value of the SessionId parameter.
The logon token. You can call the GetLoginToken operation to obtain the token. You can also call the UpdateToken operation to obtain the token RefreshLoginToken. Response parameter: LoginToken.

The cloud computer status.

Valid value:

*   Stopped
*   Starting.
*   Rebuilding
*   Running:.
*   Stopping:.
*   Expired
*   Deleted
*   Pending: The resource is still being prepared.

The number of entries per page.

*   Maximum value: 500.
*   and the default value is 10.
The token used to start the next query. If NextToken is empty, it indicates that there is no next query.
The cloud computer name.
The cloud computer ID. You can specify one or more cloud computer IDs. Valid values: 1 to 20.
The ID of the searched region. You can specify this parameter to filter cloud computers in specific regions.

The method that is used to connect cloud computers that reside in the office network from WUYING clients.

>  The VPC connection method depends on Alibaba Cloud PrivateLink. You can use PrivateLink for free. If you set this parameter to VPC or Any, the system automatically enables PrivateLink.

Valid values:

*   INTERNET (default): End users connect to cloud computers from clients over the Internet.
*   VPC: End users connect to cloud computers from clients over a virtual private cloud (VPC).
*   Any: End users connect to cloud computers from clients over the Internet or a VPC.
Specifies whether to query information about the image update.

Whether to query real-time cloud computer information. The cloud computer status information in the current interface has a delay of 1 to 3 seconds. If you need accurate information, set this value to `true`.

The field used for sorting. If you do not specify this option, the system is sorted in descending order of creation time.

Valid values:

*   AssignTime: sort by allocation time.

The sorting method.

Valid values:

*   ASC (default): the ascending order.
*   DESC: the descending order.
The keyword. Fuzzy search is supported for cloud computer IDs, cloud computer names, and end user custom cloud computer names.

The ID of the region where the office network resides. This parameter is left empty when you log on with an organization ID.

*   This parameter is required when you log on by using the office network ID.
*   If you log on by using an organization ID, this parameter can be left empty.

NextToken.description: The token used to start the next query. If NextToken is empty, it indicates that there is no next query.

Desktops.description: The details about the cloud computer.

items.description: The details about the cloud computer.

CreationTime.description: The time when the cloud computer was created.

ChargeType.description:
The billing method of the cloud computer pool.

Valid value:

*   PostPaid: pay-as-you-go
*   PrePaid: subscription

HostName.description: The hostname of the cloud desktop.

DesktopGroupId.description: The ID of the cloud computer share.

LastStartTime.description: The time when the cloud desktop was last started.

ExpiredTime.description:
The expiration time of the cloud computer.

*   For a cloud computer that is a package year or month, the return value is meaningful.
*   For pay-as-you-go cloud computers, the `2099-12-31T15:59Z` is returned.

ConnectionStatus.description:
The state of the endpoint connection.

Valid values:

*   Connected
*   Disconnecting
*   Pending.
*   Connecting.
*   Disconnected.
*   Deleting

Memory.description: The memory of the cloud computer. Unit: MiB.

DirectoryId.description: The network ID of the office. Same as `OfficeSiteId`.

DiskType.description:
The disk type.

Valid value:

*   SYSTEM: a system disk.
*   DATA: a data disk.

OsType.description:
The operating system.

Valid value:

*   Linux
*   Windows

EstablishmentTime.description: The time when the session was created.

GpuMemory.description: The GPU memory size. For GPU-accelerated cloud computers, this return value is significant. Unit: MB.

CurrentAppVersion.description: The current version number of the cloud computer.

NewAppVersion.description: The version number of the application after the update.

ReleaseNote.description: The description of the version that can be upgraded.

Size.description: The size of the update package for the cloud computer image. Unit: MiB.

ReleaseNoteEn.description: The English release note for the new image version.

ReleaseNoteJp.description: The Japanese release note for the new image version.

ProtocolType.description:
The type of the protocol.

Valid value:

*   High-definition Experience (HDX)
*   ASP

OfficeSiteId.description: The IDs of the office networks.

NetworkInterfaceIp.description: The IP address of the ENI.

ManagementFlags.description: The list of cloud computer status.

items.description:
The management status of the cloud computer.

Valid value:

*   UNDER_MAINTENANCE: in maintenance mode.
*   MIGRATING.
*   ASSIGNING: in the assigned user.
*   MIGRATING_PROTOCOL .
*   NO_FLAG: stateless.
*   ENTER_MAINTENANCE: in maintenance mode.
*   UPDATING.

RealDesktopId.description: If a shared cloud computer is assigned a real cloud computer, the ID of the cloud computer is displayed.

TimerType.description:
The type of the scheduled task.

Valid values:

*   NoOperationDisconnect: scheduled disconnection upon inactivity.
*   NoConnectShutdown: connectionless shutdown.
*   TimerBoot: scheduled start.
*   TimerReset: scheduled reset.
*   NoOperationShutdown: scheduled shutdown upon inactivity.
*   TimerShutdown: Stops the cloud computers on schedule.
*   NoOperationReboot: scheduled restart upon inactivity.
*   TimerReboot: scheduled restart.

CronExpression.description:
The CRON expression for the scheduled task.

For example, a `0 0 4 1/1 * ?` indicates that the operation is executed every day from 4:00 a.m. on the first day of each month.

Interval.description: The interval at which the monitoring data was queried. Unit: seconds.

Enforce.description: Indicates whether to forcibly execute the scheduled task. To `true` indicates that cloud computer and connection status detection are ignored, and scheduled tasks are forcibly executed.

ResetType.description:
For a reset task, you must set the reset type.

Valid values:

*   RESET_TYPE_SYSTEM: resets the system disk.
*   RESET_TYPE_USER_DISK: resets the data disk.
*   RESET_TYPE_BOTH: resets the system disk and data disk.

AllowClientSetting.description: Whether to allow clients to set policies.

OperationType.description:
The type of the scheduled task.

Valid values:

*   HIBERNATE
*   SHUTDOWN

Clients.description: The information about the supported clients.

items.description: The information about the supported clients.

Status.description:
The status of the client.

Valid values:

*   OFF: does not allow logon.
*   ON: allows logon.

ClientType.description:
The client type.

Valid values:

*   html5: the web client.
*   android: the Android client.
*   linux: Linux client.
*   ios: the iOS client.
*   windows: the Windows client.
*   macos: the macOS client.

SupportHibernation.description:
Indicates whether hibernation is supported.

Valid values:

*   true: supported
*   false: not supported

HibernationBeta.description: Indicates whether this is a beta version of the hibernation feature.

SessionType.description:
The type of the session.

Valid value:

*   SINGLE_SESSION
*   MULTIPLE_SESSION

Platform.description:
The OS platform.

Valid value:

*   Ubuntu
*   UOS
*   CentOS
*   Windows Server 2019
*   Windows Server 2016

DescribeGlobalDesktops.title: DescribeGlobalDesktops
DescribeGlobalDesktops.summary: Queries the details of cloud computers. Currently, only the region corresponding to the Chinese mainland can be queried (excluding: Nanjing-local region-shutting down).
DescribeGlobalDesktops.description:
*   This API is a centralized domain name. The endpoint is in the China (Shanghai) region. You cannot call this API operation in other regions.
*   The cloud computer status information in this interface has a delay of 1 to 3 seconds from the actual value.

schema.title: 客户端版本
登录的地域ID，用于工作区ID登录场景。
工作区ID列表。

资源类型列表，为空则查询所有资源类型。
可选范围：
云桌面：Desktop
桌面组：DesktopGroup
云应用：App 
云盘：CloudDrive

产品类型列表，为空则查询所有产品类型。
可选范围：
CloudApp：云应用
CloudBrowser：云浏览器
�AndroidCloud：云手机
CloudDesktop：云电脑
ImageBuilder：VHD Builder
ImageValidate：VHD 验证

资源ID列表。
可设置0~100个。
资源名称，支持模糊搜索。

协议类型。该参数仅用于过滤云桌面。支持范围：
- HDX(HDX协议)
- ASP(阿里巴巴自研ASP协议 [推荐])

接入类型，不传表示两种都显示。
取值范围：
互联网：INTERNET
专线：VPC
客户端语言。
资源一级类目。
资源二级类目
是否实时刷新OTA信息。
是否主动刷新。主动刷新按钮则为true，定时刷新则为false。
客户端场景，用于标识排序。
是否双中心转发。
是否查询云电脑定时任务信息，默认为true。
是否查询云桌面套餐包信息，默认为true。

QueryFailedResourceTypes.title:
查询失败的资源类型列表。取值范围：
CloudDesktop：云桌面（含云电脑和云电脑池）
CloudApp：云应用
CloudDrive：云盘

ResourceType.title:
资源类型。取值范围：
云桌面：Desktop
桌面组：DesktopGroup
云应用：App 
云盘：CloudDrive

ResourceLevel.title:
资源级别。
取值范围：
中心：Center
单元：Region

ProductType.title:
产品类型。
CloudDesktop - 云桌面
CloudApp - 云应用
AndroidCloud - 安卓云

AccessType.title:
接入类型。
取值范围：
- INTERNET(互联网)
- VPC(企业专网)
- ANY(互联网和企业专网均可以)

ProtocolType.title:
协议类型。取值范围：
- HDX(HDX协议)
- ASP(阿里巴巴自研ASP协议)

OsType.title:
操作系统类型。取值范围：
-Windows
-Linux
-Android

OsDescription.title: 操作系统平台描述信息。

SessionType.title: 会话类型。SINGLE_SESSION代表单会话，MULTIPLE_SESSION代表多会话。

ChargeType.title:
计费方式。取值范围：
- PostPaid(按量付费 [默认值])
- PrePaid(包年包月)

SubPayType.title:
子计费方式。取值范围：
- monthPackage(按月预付费模块)
- PrePaid(时长包)

ExpiredTime.title: 包年包月付费类型资源的到期时间。

AuthMode.title:
云应用授权模式。取值范围：
App：应用授权
Session：会话授权
AppInstanceGroup：交付组授权

DesktopTimers.title: 桌面定时任务设置列表。

Clients.title: 资源支持的客户端类型列表。

items.title: 资源支持的单类客户端类型设置信息。

UserPrincipalName.title: 绑定资源的用户的UPN（如果有），只有当前查询用户的Session该值才可能有值。

RealDesktopId.title: 【桌面组】真实桌面ID，当桌面组存在会话时存在。

PackageType.title:
时长包类型
     * Duration：时长包
     * NORMAL_PACKAGE：付费包（120小时包）
     * POSTPAID_PACKAGE：用于记录后付费额度包（200小时包）
     * FREE_PACKAGE：免费包

PostPaidLimitFee.title:
第二阶段包的封顶金额
     * 仅ResourceType为POSTPAID_PACKAG 和 FREE_PACKAGE时会返回

PackageUsedUpStrategy.title:
包用尽策略
     * "Postpaid" //用尽扣费
     * "Shutdown" //用尽关机或休眠

SupportedActions.title: 支持的操作类型列表，目前只支持安卓云。

DescribeUserResources.title: DescribeUserResources

UnbindUserDesktop.summary: Unbinds end users from cloud computers.

schema.description: The region ID.
The logon token.
The client type.
The client ID.
The session ID.
The cloud computer ID.

Specifies whether to enable forced unbinding.

Valid values:

*   true: Even when end users connect to cloud computers, the forced unbinding is still enforced.
*   false: Forced unbinding is only enforced when end users are disconnected from cloud computers.

schema.title: Schema of Response
schema.description: The response parameters.

400.errorMessage: The request uses the same client token as a previous, but non-identical request. Do not reuse a client token with different requests, unless the requests are identical.

UnbindUserDesktop.title: UnbindUserDesktop

GetConnectionTicket.summary: Retrieves the credential that is used to connect to a cloud computer.

schema.title: 乐播需求，获取Tickek成功后自动在session里启动乐播应用。

400.errorMessage: The specified desktop memory high load.
The specified desktop cpu high load.
Client ip %s is not in white list.

GetConnectionTicket.title: GetConnectionTicket

schema.description: The region ID. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~196646~~) operation to query the regions supported by WUYING Workspace.
The ID of the Alibaba Cloud Workspace client (hereinafter referred to as WUYING client). The system generates a unique ID for each client.
The session ID.
The logon token.
The operating system (OS) of the device that run the client.
The client version. If you use a WUYING client, you can click **About** on the client logon page to view the version of the client.
The IDs of the cloud computers. You can specify the IDs of 1 to 20 cloud computers.

items.description: The ID of the cloud computer.

schema.description: The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length. For more information, see [How to ensure idempotence](~~25693~~).
The UUID of the client.
The response parameter.

StartDesktops.title: StartDesktops
StartDesktops.description: The cloud computers that you want to start must be in the Stopped state. After you call this operation, the cloud computers enter the Running state.

StopDesktops.title: StopDesktops
StopDesktops.description: The cloud computers that you want to stop must be in the Running state. After you call this operation, the cloud computers enter the Stopped state.

ApproveFotaUpdate.summary: Enables OTA updates for cloud computers.

schema.description: The region ID. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~196646~~) operation to query the regions supported by EDS.
The ID of the Alibaba Cloud Workspace client. The system generates a unique ID for each client.

The office network ID. This parameter has the same meaning as `OfficeSiteId`. We recommend that you replace `DirectoryId` with `OfficeSiteId`. You can specify a value for `DirectoryId` or `OfficeSiteId`.
The office network ID.

The ID of the session.

*   If the virtual multi-factor authentication (MFA) device is not bound or two-factor authentication is not enabled for the client, you do not need to specify a value for `SessionId`.
*   If the virtual MFA device is not bound or two-factor authentication is enabled for the client, you must specify a value for `SessionId` to verify the user identity after you specify a value for `ADPassword`. The value of the `SessionId` parameter is returned only if the CurrentStage parameter is set to `ADPassword` when you call the `GetLoginToken` operation.

The logon authentication stage. Valid values:

*   `ADPassword`: the stage to verify the identity of the Active Directory (AD) user. You must specify the value when the system verifies the identity of a convenience account or an AD account.
*   `MFABind: the stage to bind a virtual multi-factor authentication (MFA) device.`
*   `MFAVerify: the stage to verify the verification code that is generated by the virtual MFA device.`
*   `TokenVerify`: the stage to perform two-factor authentication on an Alibaba Cloud Workspace client (hereinafter referred to as the client).
*   `ChangePassword`: the stage to change the password of the user.
*   `KeepAliveVerify`: the stage to obtain LoginToken if KeepAliveToken is valid.
The name of the convenience user or the AD user. This parameter is required if you set `CurrentStage` to `ADPassword`.
The password of the convenience user or the AD user. This parameter is required if you set `CurrentStage` to `ADPassword`.
The current password. This parameter is required if you set `CurrentStage` to `ChangePassword`.
The new password. This parameter is required if you set `CurrentStage` to `ChangePassword`.
The verification code that is generated by the virtual MFA device. This parameter is required if you set `CurrentStage` to `MFAVerify`.
The operating system (OS) of the device that runs an Alibaba Cloud Workspace client.
The version of the client. When you use an Alibaba Cloud Workspace client, you can view the client version in the **About** dialog box on the client logon page.

If two-factor authentication is enabled for Alibaba Cloud Workspace terminals in the EDS console and the system detects that the current logon user is exposed to risks, the system sends a verification code to the email address of the user. This parameter is required if you set `CurrentStage` to `TokenVerify`.

Specifies whether to keep the user logged on to the client. 
Valid values:
* null: Default value. Do not keep the user logged on to the client.
* true: Keep the user logged on to the client.
* false:  Do not keep the user logged on to the client.

The token to keep logging on to an Alibaba Cloud Workspace client. When an end user logs on to the Alibaba Cloud Workspace client and select Auto Sign-in, `KeepAliveToken` is returned after you call this operation. Within the valid period of the returned token``, you can call the `GetLoginToken` operation and set `CurrentStage` to `KeepAliveVerify`. Then, you can obtain LoginToken. If you set `CurrentStage` to `KeepAliveVerify`, `KeepAliveToken` is required.
The unique identifier of the client. When you use an Alibaba Cloud Workspace client, you can view the client version in the **About** dialog box on the client logon page.

The type of Alibaba Cloud Workspace clients.

Valid values:

*   HTML5: web client.

*   WINDOWS: Windows client.

*   MACOS: macOS client.

*   IOS: iOS client.

*   ANDROID: Android client.
The response parameters.

Email.description:
The email address of the user. The system returns the email address in the return value of the LoginToken parameter after the user logs on to the client.

*   For a convenience user, the return value is the email address specified when the administrator creates the convenience user.
*   For an AD user, the return value is in the following format: `Username@Name of the AD domain`.

Secret.description:
The key that is generated when you bind the virtual MFA device. This parameter is required when the CurrentStage parameter is set to `MFABind`.

> For more information about each authentication stage, see the parameter description of the request parameter `CurrentStage`.

EndUserId.description: The account of the convenience user or the AD user.

NextStage.description:
The next stage that is expected to enter. For example, an administrator enables MFA in the EDS console. When an end user enters the password, that is, the end user completes the `ADPassword` stage, this parameter returns `MFAVerify`. This indicates that MFA is required.

>  For more information about the authentication stages, see the `CurrentStage` parameter.

QrCodePng.description:
The QR code that is generated when the virtual MFA device is bound. The value is encoded in Base64. This parameter can be empty. This parameter is required only when the CurrentStage parameter is set to `MFABind`.

> For more information about each authentication stage, see the parameter description of the request parameter `CurrentStage`.

Label.description: The attribute of the convenience user. For an AD user, null is returned.

SessionId.description:
The ID of the session. The ID is returned the first time you call the `GetLoginToken` operation in the session. If MFA is required, you must specify this parameter in subsequent stages.

> For more information about each authentication stage, see the parameter description of the request parameter `CurrentStage`.

Phone.description: Enter the mobile number of the convenience user. For an AD user, null is returned.

TenantId.description: The ID of the Alibaba Cloud account. The ID is used for hardware client authentication.

KeepAliveToken.description: The token used to keep the user logged on. After the user logs on to the client and select the Keep Logon option, `KeepAliveToken` is returned when you call the operation. If the user does not select the Keep Logon option, null is returned.

Industry.description: > This is a parameter only for internal use.

Props.description: > This is a parameter only for internal use.

additionalProperties.description: > This is a parameter only for internal use.

WindowDisplayMode.description: > This is a parameter only for internal use.

RiskVerifyInfo.description: Risk identification information regarding the signin process.

Locked.description: Whether the account is locked or not.

Phone.description: The mobile number used for authentication.

Reason.description: > This is a parameter only for internal use.

PasswordStrategy.description: > This is a parameter only for internal use.

TenantPasswordLength.description: > This is a parameter only for internal use.

TenantAlternativeChars.description: > This is a parameter only for internal use.

items.description: > This is a parameter only for internal use.

The client version. If you use an Alibaba Cloud Workspace client, you can view the client version in the "About" dialog box on the client logon page.

If two-factor authentication is enabled for clients in the Elastic Desktop Service (EDS) Enterprise console, the system will send a verification code to the user's email address if it detects that the current logged-on user is at risk. This parameter is required if you set `CurrentStage` to `TokenVerify`.

The current password.
The new password.

ChangePassword.title: ChangePassword

schema.description: The region ID.
The client ID. The system generates a unique ID for each client.
The office network ID.
The user ID.
The email address of the user.
The phone number of the user.

The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length. For more information, see [How to ensure idempotence](~~25693~~).
The response parameters.
The region ID.
The ID of the client. The system generates a unique ID for each client.
The directory ID.
The office network ID.
The session ID.
The logon token.
The password that you want to encrypt.
The response parameters.
The region ID
The client ID. The system generates a unique ID for each client.
The session ID.
The logon token.
